Judul: IDENTIFICATION OF FACTORS AFFECTING THE PERFORMANCE AND SUSTAINABILITY OF WASTE BANKS IN URBAN AREAS: CASE STUDY OF EAST JAKARTA AND BEKASI MUNICIPALITY, INDONESIA
Abstrak:
Urban waste management becomes one of the most complex and cost-intensive
public service, i.e., it takes a large part of municipal budgets. In the Indonesian
context, Law No. 18 of 2008 related to waste management explains the new
paradigm of waste management based on society participation using the concept
of reduce, reuse, recycle (3Rs). Furthermore, the Indonesian Ministry of
Environment Regulation No. 13/2012 instituted guidelines for the
implementation of 3Rs through a waste bank identify waste banks as necessary
for transformation to an Integrated sustainable waste management (ISWM). The
aim of this research to achieve sustainability and improvement of waste bank
performance by finding and clarifying the factors that affecting the performance
of waste bank; analyzing which factor that most affecting the performance of
waste bank in urban area; and evaluating the performance of waste bank.
This report presents discussion of options to improve waste banks based on a
literature review and regulation undertaken at the national level. The main
method of this research is Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP). It is a method
for structuring the complexity of the problem in a hierarchy and assessing the
relative importance of each variable/criterion and establishing the
variable/criterion with the highest priority. Moreover, it is possible to solve the
problem which is lack of complete written data or quantitative data. First, we
synthesized the factors, indicators, and parameters affecting waste bank
management performance based on the opinions of experts in the literature
review and previous research. Secondly, we calculated weighting coefficients
using Analysis Hierarchy Process (AHP) method for each factor and indicator.
Lastly, 20 waste banks in East Jakarta and Bekasi municipalities were evaluated
by multiplying the indicator and factor scores by the corresponding weighting
coefficients. The scores are obtained from averaging the score of parameters in
each indicator by heads of waste bank. Then the results of the ranking of the

The analysis result gives information that environmental factor is the most
crucial factor which affect the performance and sustainability of waste bank.
Moreover, the weighting coefficients of indicators for environmental factors
were more or less equal, with the highest coefficient of urban carrying capacity
whose parameters include population growth, level of human activity, and level
of land use. Meanwhile, in the performance of waste bank, it shows that
government-based waste bank has the best performance (Waste Bank Central of
Kramat Jati) and the worst performance was Waste Bank Bambu Asri
(community-based).
